text: Cichlasoma bimaculatum is an omnivorous, freshwater, tropical fish commonly referred to as the black acara or two-spot cichlid. It is most frequently classified in the Cichlidae (Cichlid) family and subfamily of Cichlasomatinae. It is found in freshwater canals and swamps, with a natural region spanning from the Amazon River to northeastern and northern South America. Since the 1960s it has been identified in the Gulf of Mexico ecosystem in several counties of Florida as far north as Jacksonville. ==References== Category:Cichlasoma Category:Cichlid fish of Central America Category:Cichlid fish of North America Category:Cichlid fish of South America Category:Fish described in 1758 Category:Taxa named by Carl Linnaeus
title: Cichlasoma bimaculatum
